stlib.interfaces.moving

Interface MovingBoolIF

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GeneralTypeIF, MovingObjectIF<UnitBoolIF,BaseBoolIF>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MovingBool

    public interface MovingBoolIF
extends MovingObjectIF<UnitBoolIF,BaseBoolIF>
    Interface that should be provided by MovingBoolIF objects
    Author:
    Markus Fuessel

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • add

        boolean add(PeriodIF period,
            boolean booleanValue)
        Append this 'MovingBool' object by a further movement section defined by the passed values.
        Creates an appropriate unit object and append this to this object.
        Parameters:
        period - - time period of this movement section
        booleanValue - - boolean value for this period
        Returns:
        true if the adding was successful, false otherwise

      • add

        boolean add(PeriodIF period,
            BaseBoolIF baseBoolValue)
        Append this 'MovingBool' object by a further movement section defined by the passed values.
        Creates an appropriate unit object and append this to this object.
        Parameters:
        period - - time period of this movement section
        baseBoolValue - - BaseBoolIF value for this period
        Returns:
        true if the adding was successful, false otherwise

      • add

        boolean add(MovingBoolIF otherMovingBool)
        Extends this 'MovingBool' object by the passed 'MovingBool' object.
        The time period of the passed object must be right adjacent to or begin after the period of this object.
        Parameters:
        period - - time period of this movement section
        otherMovingBool - - 'MovingBool' to append
        Returns:
        true if the adding was successful, false otherwise
